On Tue, 10 Dec 2002 06:05:36 -0800, "Vladimir R. Bossicard"
<vbossica@...> said:
> > I think you misunderstood me.
> 
> No, no I did understand you :-)
> 
> > When you next update your JDK
>    ^^^^

You are quite right about that...  But, I would think that if you depend
on some piece of code, you will eventually upgrade it...

Ok, I'm done now :)

Bye !

> 
> what/who will remind me to upgrade the jar?
> 
> The solution I implemented is simply a todo list without the list (and 
> the maintenance).  And since it's run everytime I don't have to worry 
> that somebody will miss it.
> 
> This is IMO especially useful if you're working with OSS, where you're 
> not the only one maintaining the code and not working 100% on it.
> 
> And the code is always more accurate than the documentation :-)
> 
> But than you for your input.
> 
> -Vladimir
